title: User can open own profile from system messages or from group info
body:
### Description

*Type*: Bug

*Summary*: after user has been made admin he can open own profile from group info screen

#### Expected behavior
user can't open own profile screen from group Group info

#### Actual behavior
can see own profile with options, that cannot be performed
![ownpre](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4557972/50512284-8c2ff680-0a91-11e9-972e-1fefee46e58c.png)


### Reproduction

_Scenario 1 (for group info):_
- Open Status on (device A, user A)
- Create a group chat (device A, user A) with user B
- Make User B admin
- Log in to Status (device B, user B)
- Open group chat with user A
- Tap on ... > Group info
- Tap on ... > Open Profile on your avatar

_Scenario 2 (for system messages):_
- Open Status on (device A, user A)
- Create a group chat (device A, user A) with user B
- Tap on own avatar on message `*user A* created a group.`

### Additional Information
* Status version: nightly 28/12/2018
* Operating System: all
* Video: http://take.ms/Y9qI6
@cammellos look at this one when you have a time.

cc @rachelhamlin 
I'm not sure that it is required, but anyway, user can try to block yourself, I don't think it is desirable.
Easier to disable, agreed! Probably an xs bounty.

Hi @rachelhamlin , I have a lot of problems getting the status react app running with the latest changes, I don't know if something is broken in https://dev-docs.status.im/build_status/

I refreshed the repo with the lastest changes in Status and `react-native run-android` didn't work, I realized Gradle was missing in my system, so I installed Gradle 5.0, but no luck when I run `react-native run-android`, now the error showed is:

```
Build file '/home/sf/Developments/status-react/android/build.gradle' line: 51

* What went wrong:
A problem occurred configuring project ':@react-native-community_netinfo'.
> STATUS_GO_ANDROID_LIBDIR environment variable is not valid!
```

Hi @PombeirP , Could you give me a clue, Is this a nix problem? am I doing something wrong?

I appreciate any help! @gitcoinbot I'm working, but I'm stuck in this problem.

Hi @speedyFixer. That link seems to point to an out-of-date version of the documentation. Please use https://status.im/build_status/ instead. We have a reproducible build environment in place based on Nix, so you shouldn't use tooling outside of the Nix environment. Using the recommended Makefile targets will ensure you're using Nix for your tasks. E.g. instead of running `react-native run-android` on the shell, you should run `make run-android`.

I've taken down https://dev-docs.status.im/ entirely. I must have missed it when we moved docs under https://status.im/docs/. Not even sure how @speedyFixer found that URL, since we never publicized the pages with `dev-*` prefix, which were essentially staging for changes.
Pretty sure this is a more up-to-date guide: https://status.im/build_status/status_react_quickstart.html

Hi, really thanks @PombeirP and @jakubgs ! I didn't realize about the outdated docs, I use to use the new docs with no problem. I always look for the documentation before run the project for what I typed in Google 'status im docs', and the results lead me to the outdated docs.

I did a video with the behavior:
[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UeH7e6Gu6As](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UeH7e6Gu6As)

This simple issue made me waste a lot of time, Now I'm going to check with the new docs. Thanks again!

Thanks for pointing that out, it does indeed lead you to the `dev` page. I've updated the sitemap URL in the Google Search Console, it might take a bit for the results to change but they should be correct soon.

But I've also verified that Google doesn't list the site itself and it says it does:
![dev_docs_google_not_listed](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2212681/64896806-1daabd00-d64f-11e9-87ac-27b70579f601.png)
I've temporarily put up the site with just a `robots.txt` with `Disallow: /` and forced a re-indexing.
I'll check up on this on Monday and see if it's fixed.
Added a `301` redirect from `dev-docs.status.im` to `status.im/docs`: https://github.com/status-im/infra-misc/commit/9c38229d
